item.title: Mary add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Mary add a quote by Laura Hillenbrand
item.description: "The paradox of vengefulness is that it makes men dependent upon those who have harmed them, believing that their release from pain will come only when their tormentors suffer." -- Laura Hillenbrand

item.title: Mary add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I have often thought that if heaven had given me choice of my position and calling, it should have been on a rich spot of earth, well watered, and near a good market for the productions of the garden. No occupation is so delightful to me as the culture of the earth, and no lucture comparable to that of the garden. Sucha a variety of subjeccts, some one always coming to perfection, the failure of one thing repaired by the succes of another, and instead of one harvest a continued one through the year. Under a total want of demand except for our family table, I am still devoted to the garden." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Mary add a quote by Faith Whittlesey
item.description: "Remember, Ginger Rogers did everything Fred Astaire did, but she did it backwards and in high heels.(U.S. ambassador, 1939- )" -- Faith Whittlesey

item.title: Mary add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we will not learn to eat the only food that the universe grows-the only food that any possible universe ever can grow-then we must starve eternally." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Mary add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The exquisitely bad is as satisfying to the soul as the exquisitely good. Only the mediocre is unendurable." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mary add a quote by Robert Specht
Mary add a quote by Richard Adams
item.description: "Animals don't behave like men,' he said. 'If they have to fight, they fight; and if they have to kill they kill. But they don't sit down and set their wits to work to devise ways of spoiling other creatures' lives and hurting them. They have dignity and animality." -- Richard Adams

item.title: Mary add a quote by Jan Struther
item.description: "It oughtn't to need a war to make us talk to each other in buses, and invent our own amusements in the evenings, and live simply, and eat sparingly, and recover the use of our legs, and get up early enough to see the sun rise." -- Jan Struther

item.title: Mary add a quote by Amy Tan
item.description: "If you can't change your fate, change your attitude." -- Amy Tan

item.title: Mary add a quote by Joan Crawford
item.description: "I find suggestion a hell of a lot more provocative than explicit detail. You didn't see Clark[Gable] and Vivien[leigh] rolling around in bed in Gone With The Wind, but you saw that shit eating grin on her face the next morning and you knew damned well she'd gotten properly laid." -- Joan Crawford

item.title: Mary add a quote by Rebecca Wells
item.description: "Listen to me, Siddalee, and listen good: There is no excuse to let your looks go, no matter how poor you are. Cleanliness is next to Godliness, but honey let me tell you, ugliness will get you nowhere." -- Rebecca Wells

item.title: Mary add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Mary add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Without ambition one starts nothing. Without work one finishes nothing. The prize will not be sent to you. You have to win it." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Mary add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "If we encounter a man of rare intellect, we should ask him what books he reads." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Mary add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "What is hell? I maintain that it is the suffering of being unable to love." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Mary add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Mary add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Mary add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Mary add a quote by Janet Evanovich
item.description: "I'm telling you, it's fu**ing hard to be classy" -- Janet Evanovich

item.title: Mary add a quote by Janet Evanovich
item.description: "I wasn't sure exactly how prostitutes determined price, but if men bought hookers by the pound, these two would be doing okay." -- Janet Evanovich

item.title: Mary add a quote by Louis L'Amour
item.description: "Up to a point a personâ€™s life is shaped by environment, heredity, and changes in the world about them. Then there comes a time when it lies within their grasp to shape the clay of their life into the sort of thing they wish it to be. Only the weak blame parents, their race, their times, lack of good fortune or the quirks of fate. Everyone has the power to say, "This I am today. That I shall be tomorrow." -- Louis L'Amour
